ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, in which room does your child sleep most of the time?
Notes: 1= In his/her own room; 2= In parents' room; 3= In siblings' or other person's room; 4= In another room of the house; 5= Other

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, in which room does your child sleep most of the time? Other (describe)
During the past week in a typical night, where does your child usually fall asleep at bedtime?
Notes: 1= Crib; 2= Own bed (any size); 3= Parent's bed; 4= Co-sleeper (attached to parent's bed); 5= Bassinet/infant seat; 6= Swing/stroller; 7= Parent's/adult's arms; 8= Other

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, where does your child usually fall asleep at bedtime? Other (describe)
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following does your child sleep in/on most of the time?
Notes: 1= Own bed (any size); 2= Parents' bed (any size); 3= Bed (any size) shared with a sibling or other person; 4= Couch on his/her own; 5= Couch shared with a parent, sibling, or other person; 6= Floor; 7= Other

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, which of the following does your child sleep in/on most of the time? Other (describe)
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Bath
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Massage
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Reading books/being read to

During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Use tablet/smartphone/gaming system

During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Have dinner/snack/ breastfeeding or bottle-feeding
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Sing songs
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Run around
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Brush teeth
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Play
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Cuddle
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Say prayers
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Listen to music
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Other
During the past week in a typical night, which of the following usually occurred on most nights for your child in the hour before bedtime? (Please check all that apply): Other (describe)
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): While being cuddled
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): While watching television
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): While playing with tablet/smartphone/gaming system
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): In his/her own bed/sleep space with a parent in the room
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): In a parents' bed/sleep space and a parent in the room
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): In his/her own bed/sleep space alone in the room
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): In another room of the house (e.g., living room)
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): In parents' bed/sleep space alone In the room
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): Other
During the past week in a typical night, how does your child fall asleep most of the time? (Please check all that apply): Other (describe)
During the past week in a typical night, how often does your child have the exact same bedtime routine? (CHECK ONE)
Notes: 1= Never; 2= 1-2 nights per week; 3= 3-4 nights per week; 4= 5-6 nights per week; 5= Every night

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, what time do you usually start your child's bedtime routine?
During the past week in a typical night, are there usually electronics (e.g. television, smartphone, or tablet) in the room where your child falls asleep at bedtime?

During the past week in a typical night, are there usually electronics (e.g. television, smartphone, or tablet) in the room where your child falls asleep at bedtime? If yes, check all that apply: Computer

During the past week in a typical night, are there usually electronics (e.g. television, smartphone, or tablet) in the room where your child falls asleep at bedtime? If yes, check all that apply: Television

During the past week in a typical night, are there usually electronics (e.g. television, smartphone, or tablet) in the room where your child falls asleep at bedtime? If yes, check all that apply: Smartphone/cellphone

During the past week in a typical night, are there usually electronics (e.g. television, smartphone, or tablet) in the room where your child falls asleep at bedtime? If yes, check all that apply: Tablet

During the past week in a typical night, are there usually electronics (e.g. television, smartphone, or tablet) in the room where your child falls asleep at bedtime? If yes, check all that apply: Video game system/gaming system

During the past week in a typical night, are there usually electronics (e.g. television, smartphone, or tablet) in the room where your child falls asleep at bedtime? If yes, check all that apply: Other

During the past week in a typical night, are there usually electronics (e.g. television, smartphone, or tablet) in the room where your child falls asleep at bedtime? If yes, check all that apply: Other (describe)
During the past week in a typical night, what time do you usually put your child to bed at night (meaning what time is lights out)?
During the past week in a typical night, how regularly do you put your child to bed at the same time (within 15 minutes)?
Notes: 1= 0 nights; 2= 1 nights; 3= 2 nights; 4= 3 nights; 5= 4 nights; 6= 5 nights; 7= 6 nights; 8= 7 nights

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, how difficult is bedtime for your child, for example, fussing, crying, protesting (CHECK ONE)?
Notes: 1= Very easy; 2= Somewhat easy; 3= Somewhat difficult; 4= Moderately difficult; 5= Very difficult

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, how long does it typically take your child to fall asleep? (Example: If you put your child to bed at 8:15 PM and your child falls asleep at 8:30 PM, it took 15 minutes for your child to fall asleep.)
During the past week in a typical night, in what room does your child sleep for most of the night?
Notes: 1= In his/her own room; 2= In sibling's or other bedroom; 3= In parent's room; 4= In another room of the house

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, in what room does your child sleep for most of the night? Describe
During the past week in a typical night, please select ''Very often'' (ATTENTION CHECK ITEM)
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Most of the time; 5= Very often

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, thinking about caffeinated beverages such as Coke, Pepsi, Mountain Dew, iced teas, and coffee, how many cups or cans of caffeinated beverages does your child typically drink each day?
Notes: Number of caffeinated drinks per day

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, what caffeinated drink does your child have (Check ALL that apply)? Coke, Pepsi, or Mountain Dew
During the past week in a typical night, what caffeinated drink does your child have (Check ALL that apply)? Iced tea
During the past week in a typical night, what caffeinated drink does your child have (Check ALL that apply)? Coffee
During the past week in a typical night, what caffeinated drink does your child have (Check ALL that apply)? Other
During the past week in a typical night, what caffeinated drink does your child have (Check ALL that apply)? Other (describe)
During the past week in a typical night, how often, if ever, does your child have a difficult time falling asleep at night? (CHECK ONE)
Notes: 1= Every night; 2= 5-6 nights per week; 3= 3-4 nights per week; 4= 1-2 nights per week; 5= 1-3 nights per month; 6= Less than once a month; 7= Never

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, how many times does your child typically wake during the night?
During the past week in a typical night, when your child wakes up during the night, what do you do? (Check all that apply): Go to my child but leave while child is still awake

During the past week in a typical night, when your child wakes up during the night, what do you do? (Check all that apply): Comfort my child in his/her bed/sleep space until child falls back asleep and then go back to my room
During the past week in a typical night, when your child wakes up during the night, what do you do? (Check all that apply): Sleep with my child in his/her bed/sleep space for the rest of the night
During the past week in a typical night, when your child wakes up during the night, what do you do? (Check all that apply): Allow my child to sleep in my bed/sleep space
During the past week in a typical night, when your child wakes up during the night, what do you do? (Check all that apply): Give my child a few minutes to see if he/she falls back to sleep
During the past week in a typical night, when your child wakes up during the night, what do you do? (Check all that apply): Play with my child
During the past week in a typical night, when your child wakes up during the night, what do you do? (Check all that apply): Sing to my child
During the past week in a typical night, when your child wakes up during the night, what do you do? (Check all that apply): Not applicable, my child does not wake at night
During the past week in a typical night, when your child wakes up during the night, what do you do? (Check all that apply): Other (describe)

During the past week in a typical night, how much total time during the NIGHT is your child awake? (Example: if your child woke up 2 times and was awake for about 15 minutes each time, your child's total time spent awake would be 30 minutes)
During the past week in a typical night, on a typical night, what is the longest stretch of time that your child is asleep during the NIGHT without waking up?
During the past week in a typical night, how much total time does your child spend sleeping during the NIGHT (between 7:00 in the evening and 8:00 in the morning)?
During the past week in a typical night, how many naps does your child take during a typical DAY (between 8:00 in the morning and 7:00 in the evening)?
How much total time does your child spend sleeping during the DAY (between 8:00 in the morning and 7:00 in the evening)?
During the past week in a typical night, please rate how well your child usually sleeps at night. (CHECK ONE)
Notes: 1= Very well; 2= Well; 3=Fairly well; 4=Fairly poorly; 5=Very poorly; 6=Poorly

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, do you consider your child's sleep to be a problem? (CHECK ONE)
Notes: 1= Not a problem at all; 2= A very small problem; 3= A small problem; 4= A moderate problem; 5= A serious problem

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, does your child snore during sleep?
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Only when he/she has a cold or allergies; 3= Sometimes; 4= Almost always/always

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, how often does your child walk or talk in his/her sleep, if ever?
Notes: 1= Every night; 2= 5-6 nights per week; 3= 3-4 nights per week; 4= 1-2 nights per week; 5= 1-3 nights per month; 6= Less than once a month; 7= Never

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, how often does your child wake with intense fears or nightmares, if ever?
Notes: 1= Every night; 2= 5-6 nights per week; 3= 3-4 nights per week; 4= 1-2 nights per week; 5= 1-3 nights per month; 6= Less than once a month; 7= Never

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, how often is your child afraid of going to sleep at night, if ever?
Notes: 1= Every night; 2= 5-6 nights per week; 3= 3-4 nights per week; 4= 1-2 nights per week; 5= 1-3 nights per month; 6= Less than once a month; 7= Never

ElementDescription: During the past week in a typical night, how many times does your child typically call for attention or call to request something after ''lights out''? Write the total number of times (e.g. events) on a ''typical'' night that your child called for attention or called to request something. Include both those occasions when you responded to your child and/or went to your child's room/sleep space AND those occasions when you just let your child ''call out'' but didn't respond. Count calling out multiple times in succession, ex. ''Mommy, mommy, mommy'' as ''one time''.

During the past week in a typical night, how many times does your child get out of bed after ''lights out''? Write the total number of times on a ''typical'' night that your child got out his/her bed/sleep space on his/her own. Enter the total number of times, whether or not you attended to your child, and whether or not you put your child back in his/her bed/sleep space.
Notes: Number of times getting out of bed

ElementDescription: During the past week, what time does your child typically wake up in the morning?
During the past two weeks, how would you rate your child's mood when your child wakes up in the morning? (CHECK ONE)
Notes: 1= Very happy; 2= Somewhat happy; 3= Neither happy nor fussy; 4= Somewhat fussy; 5= Very fussy

ElementDescription: During the past week, how confident have you felt in managing your child's sleep?
Notes: 1= Very confident; 2= Somewhat confident; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat unsure; 5= Very unsure
